term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - electron work function, Φ
term.title: electron work function

item.text: The minimum work needed to extract electrons from the Fermi level of a metal M across a surface carrying no net charge. It is equal to the sum of the potential energy and the kinetic Fermi energy taken with the reverse sign: Φ M =- ( V e + ɛ e F ) is the potential energy for electrons in metals and ɛe^F is the kinetic energy of electrons at the Fermi level.

item.alttext: Φ M =- ( V e + ɛ e F )

item.meaning: Kinetic energy of an electron in the fermi level
